chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
l: pos n
h: pos n
a: pos n
s: pos n
Hsa: s <> a
Hsh: s <> h
Hsl: s <> l
Hah: a <> h
Hal: a <> l
Hhl: h <> l
lt: list (list bool * list bool)
p: nat
i: nat
lFD: nat
v: Vector.t (list bool) n
ln: list nat
lc: list bool

Goal:
v#>h = nil -> v#>l = nil -> v#>a = nil -> v#>s = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc -> (Exists (fun x : nat => length lt <= x) ln \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln /\ (exists k : nat, lc = list_repeat Zero (S k))) \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < length lt) ln /\ lc = nil /\ (let (hh, ll) := tile_concat ln lt in hh <> ll) -> (i, main_loop) // (i, v) ->> (i, v[(list_bool_next (v#>s))/s])

Premises:

list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
decoder_spec_nok_1 : forall (c h l : pos n) (q s i : nat) (ll : list (list bool * list bool)) (v : vec (list bool) n) (k : nat), v#>c = list_repeat Zero k -> exists r : nat, (i, decoder c h l q s i ll) // (i, v) -> > (q, v[(list_repeat Zero r)/c])
bsm_steps_POP_E_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = nil -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b : nat | b < a /\ P // (q, v) -[b] -> st}
increment_erase_spec : forall (i p : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ln mn : list bool) (w : vec (list bool) n), list_bool_succ ln mn -> v#>s = ln -> w = v[mn/s][nil/h][nil/l][nil/a] -> (i, increment_erase i p) // (i, v) -> > (p, w)
decoder = fun (c h l : pos n) (q : nat) => let decoder_error := PUSH c Zero :: POP c q q :: nil in fix decoder (s i : nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)) {struct lt} : list (bsm_instr n) := match lt with | nil => decoder_error | (th, tl) :: lt0 => POP c (3 + length (tile h l th tl) + i) q :: tile h l th tl ++ PUSH c Zero :: POP c s s :: decoder s (3 + length (tile h l th tl) + i) lt0 end : pos n -> pos n -> pos n -> nat -> nat -> nat -> list (list bool * list bool) -> list (bsm_instr n) Arguments decoder _ _ _ (_ _ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
decoder_length : forall (c h l : pos n) (q s i : nat) (lt : list (list bool * list bool)), length (decoder c h l q s i lt) = length_decoder lt
bsm_steps_POP_0_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (ll : list bool) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = Zero :: ll -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b : nat | b < a /\ P // (p, v[ll/x]) -[b] -> st}
compare_stack_eq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (p, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)
copy_rev_stack_spec : forall x y z : pos n, x <> y -> x <> z -> y <> z -> forall (i : nat) (l : list bool) (v w : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = l -> w = v[nil/x][(rev l ++ v#>y)/y][(rev l ++ v#>z)/z] -> (i, copy_rev_stack x y z i) // (i, v) -> > (9 + i, w)
bsm_steps_POP_any_inv : forall (n a : nat) (P : nat * list (bsm_instr n)) (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (b : bool) (ll : list bool) (v : vec (list bool) n) (st : nat * vec (list bool) n), (i, POP x p q :: nil) <sc P -> v#>x = b :: ll -> p = 1 + i -> st <> (i, v) -> P // (i, v) -[a] -> st -> {b0 : nat | b0 < a /\ P // (1 + i, v[ll/x]) -[b0] -> st}
compare_stack_neq_spec : forall x y : pos n, x <> y -> forall (i p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x <> v#>y -> exists w : vec (list bool) n, (i, compare_stacks x y i p q) // (i, v) -> > (q, w) /\ (forall z : pos n, z <> x -> z <> y -> v#>z = w#>z)

```coq
intros H1 H2 H3 H4 H.
destruct H as [[Hex | [Hall [k Hk]]] | [Hall [Hnil Hneq]]].
- apply full_decoder_ko_spec with (p := p) (lt := lt) in Hex as [w [Hr1 Hw]].
  unfold main_loop.
  eapply rtc_trans with (t1 := (i, v)).
  + apply list_trans with (v0 := (i, v)).
    apply Hr1.
  + apply increment_erase_spec with (ln := v#>s).
    * apply list_bool_next.
    * apply H4.
    * rewrite <- Hw.
      apply H4.
    * simpl. auto.
- apply main_loop_ok_spec with (ln := ln) (lt := lt) in H3 as [w [Hr1 Hw]].
  + unfold main_loop.
    eapply rtc_trans with (t1 := (i, v)).
    * apply list_trans with (v0 := (i, v)).
      apply Hr1.
    * apply increment_erase_spec with (ln := v#>s).
      apply list_bool_next.
      apply H4. 
      rewrite <- Hw.
      apply H4.
      simpl. auto.
  + exact H2.
  + exact H1.
  + exact Hall.
  + rewrite <- H3. auto.
- eapply rtc_trans.
  + apply full_decoder_ok_spec with (q := i) (lt := lt) in Hall as Hr1.
    rewrite H4 in Hr1. simpl in Hr1.
    destruct (tile_concat ln lt) as [th [tl Htl]].
    assert (HH: th <> tl). exact Hneq.
    exfalso.
    apply Htl ; assumption.
  + apply increment_erase_spec with (ln := v#>s).
    apply list_bool_next.
    rewrite <- H4.
    simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.
```
